sentence.text: The polo family serine threonine kinase protein phosphorylation has been proposed as a therapeutic target in advanced cancers based on increased expression in primary human cancers, facilitation of tumor growth in murine xenograft models, and centrosomal amplification induced by its overexpression.
Our results validate Plk4 as a therapeutic target in cancer patients and reveal a new role for Plk4 in regulating Arp2/3 complex-mediated actin nucleation/3-mediated actin cytoskeletal rearrangement.
